verses.verse: "Woe<WH1945> to the rebellious<WH5637> children,<WH1121>" declares<WH5002> the Lord,<WH3068> "Who execute<WH6213> a plan,<WH6098> but not Mine,<WH4480> And make<WH5259> an alliance,<WH4541> but not of My Spirit,<WH7307> In order<WH4616> to add<WH5595> sin<WH9128> to sin;<WH9128>

Who proceed<WH1980> down<WH3381> to Egypt,<WH4714> Without<WH3808> consulting<WH7592> Me, To take<WH5756> refuge<WH5756> in the safety<WH4581> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> And to seek<WH2620> shelter<WH2620> in the shadow<WH6738> of Egypt!<WH4714>
"Therefore the safety<WH4581> of Pharaoh<WH6547> will be your shame,<WH1322> And the shelter<WH2622> in the shadow<WH6738> of Egypt,<WH4714> your humiliation.<WH3639>
"For their princes<WH8269> are at Zoan,<WH6814> And their ambassadors<WH4397> arrive<WH5060> at Hanes.<WH2609>

"Everyone<WH3605> will be ashamed<WH954> because<WH5921> of a people<WH5971> who cannot<WH3808> profit<WH3276> them, [Who are] not for help<WH5828> or profit,<WH3276> but for shame<WH1322> and also<WH1571> for reproach.<WH2781>"

The oracle<WH9294> concerning the beasts<WH929> of the Negev.<WH5045> Through a land<WH776> of distress<WH6869> and anguish,<WH9474> From where<WH1992> [come] lioness<WH3833> and lion,<WH3918> viper<WH660> and flying<WH5774> serpent,<WH8314> They carry<WH5375> their riches<WH2428> on the backs<WH3802> of young<WH5895> donkeys<WH5895> And their treasures<WH214> on camels' humps,<WH1707> To a people<WH5971> who cannot<WH3808> profit<WH3276> [them;]
Even Egypt,<WH4714> whose help<WH5826> is vain<WH1892> and empty.<WH7385> Therefore,<WH3651> I have called<WH7121> her "Rahab<WH7294> who<WH1992> has been exterminated.<WH7674>"

Now<WH6258> go,<WH935> write<WH3789> it on a tablet<WH3871> before<WH854> them And inscribe<WH2710> it on a scroll,<WH5612> That it may serve<WH1961> in the time<WH3117> to come<WH314> As a witness forever.<WH5704> <WH5769>
For this<WH1931> is a rebellious<WH4805> people,<WH5971> false<WH3586> sons,<WH1121> Sons<WH1121> who refuse<WH3808> <WH14> to listen<WH8085> To the instruction<WH8451> of the Lord;<WH3068>

Who<WH834> say<WH559> to the seers,<WH9536> "You must not see<WH7200> [visions";] And to the prophets,<WH2374> "You must not prophesy<WH2372> to us what<WH5228> is right,<WH5228> Speak<WH1696> to us pleasant<WH9142> words,<WH9142> Prophesy<WH2372> illusions.<WH4123>
"Get<WH5493> out of the way,<WH1870> turn<WH5186> aside<WH5186> from the path,<WH734> Let us hear<WH7673> no<WH7673> <WH4480> more<WH7673> about the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>"

Therefore<WH3651> thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel,<WH3478> "Since<WH3282> you have rejected<WH3988> this<WH2088> word,<WH1697> And have put<WH982> your trust<WH982> in oppression<WH6233> and guile,<WH3868> and have relied<WH8172> on them,

Therefore<WH3651> this<WH2088> iniquity<WH5771> will be to you Like a breach<WH6556> about to fall,<WH5307> A bulge<WH1158> in a high<WH7682> wall,<WH2346> Whose<WH834> collapse<WH7667> comes<WH935> suddenly<WH6597> in an instant.<WH6621>

"And whose collapse<WH7665> is like the smashing<WH7667> of a potter's jar;<WH9311> So ruthlessly<WH3808> <WH2550> shattered<WH3807> That a sherd<WH2789> will not be found<WH4672> among its pieces<WH4386> To take<WH2846> fire<WH784> from a hearth,<WH3344> Or to scoop<WH2834> water<WH4325> from a cistern.<WH1360>"

For thus<WH3541> the Lord<WH136> God,<WH3068> the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> of Israel,<WH3478> has said,<WH559> "In repentance<WH7729> and rest<WH5183> you shall be saved,<WH3467> In quietness<WH8252> and trust<WH985> is your strength.<WH1369>" But you were not willing,<WH14>

And you said,<WH559> "No,<WH3808> for we will flee<WH5127> on horses,<WH5483>" Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> you shall flee!<WH5127> "And we will ride<WH7392> on swift<WH7031> [horses,]" Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> those who pursue<WH7291> you shall be swift.<WH7043>

One<WH259> thousand<WH505> [shall flee<WH5127>] at the threat<WH1606> of one<WH259> [man,] You shall flee at the threat<WH1606> of five;<WH2568> Until<WH5704> <WH518> you are left<WH3498> as a flag<WH8650> on a mountain<WH2022> top,<WH7218> And as a signal<WH5251> on a hill.<WH1389>

Therefore<WH3651> the Lord<WH3068> longs<WH2442> to be gracious<WH2603> to you, And therefore<WH3651> He waits<WH2442> on high<WH7311> to have<WH7355> compassion<WH7355> on you. For the Lord<WH3068> is a God<WH430> of justice;<WH4941> How blessed<WH835> are all<WH3605> those who long<WH2442> for Him.

O people<WH5971> in Zion,<WH6726> inhabitant<WH3427> in Jerusalem,<WH3389> you will weep<WH1058> no<WH3808> longer.<WH1058> He will surely<WH2603> be gracious<WH2603> to you at the sound<WH6963> of your cry;<WH2199> when He hears<WH8085> it, He will answer<WH6030> you.

And your ears<WH241> will hear<WH8085> a word<WH1697> behind<WH4480> <WH310> you, "This<WH2088> is the way,<WH1870> walk<WH1980> in it," whenever<WH3588> you turn<WH3231> to the right<WH3231> or to the left.<WH8041>

And you will defile<WH2930> your graven<WH6456> images,<WH6456> overlaid<WH6826> with silver,<WH3701> and your molten<WH4541> images<WH4541> plated<WH642> with gold.<WH2091> You will scatter<WH2219> them as an impure<WH1739> thing;<WH1739> [and] say<WH559> to them, "Be gone!<WH3318>"

Then He will give<WH5414> [you] rain<WH4306> for the seed<WH2233> which<WH834> you will sow<WH2232> in the ground,<WH127> and bread<WH3899> [from] the yield<WH8393> of the ground,<WH127> and it will be rich<WH1879> and plenteous;<WH8082> on that day<WH3117> your livestock<WH4735> will graze<WH7462> in a roomy<WH7337> pasture.<WH9221>

Also the oxen<WH504> and the donkeys<WH5895> which work<WH5647> the ground<WH127> will eat<WH398> salted<WH2548> fodder,<WH1098> which<WH834> has been winnowed<WH2219> with shovel<WH7371> and fork.<WH4214>

And on every<WH3605> lofty<WH1364> mountain<WH2022> and on every<WH3605> high<WH5375> hill<WH1389> there will be streams<WH6388> running<WH2988> with water<WH4325> on the day<WH3117> of the great<WH7227> slaughter,<WH2027> when the towers<WH4026> fall.<WH5307>

And the light<WH216> of the moon<WH3842> will be as the light<WH216> of the sun,<WH2535> and the light<WH216> of the sun<WH2535> will be seven<WH7659> times<WH7659> [brighter,] like the light<WH216> of seven<WH7651> days,<WH3117> on the day<WH3117> the Lord<WH3068> binds<WH2280> up the fracture<WH7667> of His people<WH5971> and heals<WH7495> the bruise<WH4273> He has inflicted.<WH4347>

Behold,<WH2009> the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068> comes<WH935> from a remote<WH4801> place;<WH4801> Burning<WH1197> is His anger,<WH639> and dense<WH3514> is [His] smoke;<WH4858> His lips<WH8193> are filled<WH4390> with indignation,<WH2195> And His tongue<WH3956> is like a consuming<WH398> fire;<WH784>

And His breath<WH7307> is like an overflowing<WH7857> torrent,<WH5158> Which reaches<WH2673> to the neck,<WH6677> To shake<WH5130> the nations<WH1471> back<WH5130> and forth in a sieve,<WH5299> And to [put] in the jaws<WH3895> of the peoples<WH5971> the bridle<WH7448> which leads<WH8582> to ruin.<WH8582>

You will have<WH1961> songs<WH7892> as in the night<WH3915> when you keep<WH6942> the festival;<WH2282> And gladness<WH8057> of heart<WH3824> as when one marches<WH1980> to [the sound of] the flute,<WH2485> To go<WH935> to the mountain<WH2022> of the Lord,<WH3068> to the Rock<WH6697> of Israel.<WH3478>
